newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks rise 2.37 pct despite finance turmoil.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks rise 2.37 pct despite finance turmoil.

text.p: Thai stocks rallied in early trade on Friday extending a foreign-led technical rally despite anticipation of a heavy sell-off of finance stocks after the suspension of nine listed finance firms, tarders said.
After opening lower the SET index bounced back to rise 12.32 points to 532.34 points by 0332 GMT. The SET 50 rose 1.13 points or 3.01 percent to 38.73 in trade worth 772 million baht.
"I think there are lot of foreigners who sold out two or three weeks ago covering short positions before the Hong Kong handover market closure," said an analyst at a Thai Military Bank affiliate.
The finance sector was down 2.56 points as the risks to equity investors in the sector increased on the possibility that other stocks could face suspension, traders said.
Most other key sectors were all sharply higher.
Thai Farmers Bank Plc was up three to 86, Advanced Info Services Plc added 11 to 206 and Tipco Asphalt Plc gained four to 132.
